Key Arguments: The legislation curtails freedom of speech and undermines democracy.
The government has been a major source of misinformation, particularly during the pandemic.
The exemption of government and professional news from scrutiny reveals bias in the legislation.
The bill could lead to censorship and suppression of dissenting voices, particularly those of scientists and academics.
The penalties proposed are extortionate and designed to instill fear, suppressing free speech.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth, as this could lead to totalitarianism.
Notable Quotes: Without freedom of speech and robust open public debate in our country, there can be no democracy.
The greatest perpetrators of misinformation during the recent pandemic was the government.
A government that can censor its critics has licence for every atrocity – it is the beginning of totalitarianism.
Propaganda is to a democracy what the bludgeon is to a totalitarian state’ (Noam Chomsky).
